definition: to be gravely mistaken (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

sentences.english: If he thinks I’d marry him， he has another think coming.
sentences.chinese: 如果他認爲我會跟他結婚，那就大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: "Don't put all your eggs in one basket." is all wrong.
sentences.chinese: “別把所有的雞蛋放進一個籃子”之說大錯特錯。

sentences.english: 'Ask your pardon, sir, you would be very wrong, ' quoth Silver.
sentences.chinese: 請恕我直言，先生，那樣你就大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: Colossal . She looks like a mailbox.
sentences.chinese: 大錯特錯她看起來像一個郵筒。

sentences.english: But in fact, it has gone terribly wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但事實上，這個文段大錯特錯。

sentences.english: The stereotype of the unemotional Chinese is not entirely accurate.
sentences.chinese: 認爲中國人不易動感情，那是大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: The wrong is too great to be redressed.
sentences.chinese: 大錯特錯以致無法補救。

sentences.english: But to claim it is the greenest option is just wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但聲稱這樣做是最環保的選擇可就大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: But what a mistake it would be.
sentences.chinese: 但那將是一個大錯特錯的決定。

sentences.english: If you think that this isn’t design-related, you are totally wrong.
sentences.chinese: 如果你認爲這一點與設計無關，那麼你就大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: Don't play dumb with me. If you think you can fool me, you are sorely mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 別跟我裝聾作啞，如果你以爲能騙我，就大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: But if you see it as a simple step-at-a-time procedure, you make a serious mistake.
sentences.chinese: 但如果把它看作爲逐步實現的過程，你就大錯特錯了。

sentences.english: If he thinks that he can suborn me, he is grievously in error.
sentences.chinese: 如果他認爲可以收買我，那他就大錯特錯了。

definition: display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
double standard
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to digress/to stray from the subject
complete nonsense (idiom)
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
to talk nonsense/nonsense!
to act recklessly/to mess around
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to spend (money or time)
